problem.p: A small block of mass m slides on a long horizontal table when it encounters a wedge of mass 2m and height h (see the diagram).
The wedge can also slide along the table. The mass slides up the wedge all the way to the top and then slides back down, never getting over the top. All surfaces are frictionless.

As the block is sliding up the wedge, what happens to the kinetic energy of the block; the potential energy of the block; the mechanical energy of the block+Earth system; the kinetic energy of the wedge (respectively)?

choicegroup.choice: decreases; increases; stays the same; increases
decreases; increases; stays the same; stays the same
increases; decreases; stays the same; stays the same
